title: Vi postage costs
body: $30us for postage isn't steep. Its fucking vertical.

replies.body:
I have to admit, thats a little pricy :S
shipping is the only reason I didn't buy the project fora figure.

maybe you could ask around and see if anyone else in your area (or even country) is looking to buy things at the same time, as the shipping will remain roughly the same even if you buy a lot more items.
Then it all comes as one big package, and then once it reaches the country, you can divide it up and send it its different ways.

> [{quoted}](name=Lord Sesshomaru,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=woTYEbny,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-12-30T01:12:53.936+0000)
>
> I have to admit, thats a little pricy :S
> shipping is the only reason I didn't buy the project fora figure.
> 
> maybe you could ask around and see if anyone else in your area (or even country) is looking to buy things at the same time, as the shipping will remain roughly the same even if you buy a lot more items.
> Then it all comes as one big package, and then once it reaches the country, you can divide it up and send it its different ways.

was all set to buy one today but the postage turned me right off. $30US is just taking the piss.
You can find the figures on EB website last time i checked with like $3.99 postage, riot just thought "Hey if they buy it from us, we can pretend to ship it from America and ask for bs shipping fees"

I believe he is talking about the Vi unlocked figure not the small figurines, which isn't available in AUS so does ship from the US. The smaller stuff like clothing or the small figures only cost $10 in postage and also ship from the US. As far as I know the only official League merch available locally (at EB) is the pop vinyls, which I don't believe are available on the Riot Merch site.

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=woTYEbny,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2016-12-30T16:48:45.184+0000)
>
> I believe he is talking about the Vi unlocked figure not the small figurines, which isn't available in AUS so does ship from the US. The smaller stuff like clothing or the small figures only cost $10 in postage and also ship from the US. As far as I know the only official League merch available locally (at EB) is the pop vinyls, which I don't believe are available on the Riot Merch site.

Yep.

But the postage costs are still absurd. Even moreso with the a$ weakening against the us$
The only time I don't see absurd postage is when it's either local or from China and you have to wait 40-60 days to get it.

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=woTYEbny,comment-id=000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-12-31T02:26:28.911+0000)
>
> The only time I don't see absurd postage is when it's either local or from China and you have to wait 40-60 days to get it.

So you reckon a chines knock off is the way to go? 

;p

Haha well the knockoff discussion aside, I believe the reason it's so much cheaper is because it's sea freight. When I've bought stuff from China in such a manner the boxes are usually mangled by the time they get to me (though the goods are still intact), which for businesses as opposed to private sellers is unacceptable for the vast majority of people.

Do I think $30 in postage is steep? Sure, but for something that size and durability it's a lot less that I've seen in other places.

If you went for a chinese knockoff? Well let's just say you get what you pay for in that respect.

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=woTYEbny,comment-id=00000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-01-02T04:46:01.192+0000)
>
> Haha well the knockoff discussion aside, I believe the reason it's so much cheaper is because it's sea freight. When I've bought stuff from China in such a manner the boxes are usually mangled by the time they get to me (though the goods are still intact), which for businesses as opposed to private sellers is unacceptable for the vast majority of people.
> 
> Do I think $30 in postage is steep? Sure, but for something that size and durability it's a lot less that I've seen in other places.
> 
> If you went for a chinese knockoff? Well let's just say you get what you pay for in that respect.

And then plot twist, they are all made in China, just that some were shipped to US first before reaching AUS, hence the $30 shipping cost from US and whatever cheaper price from China.

But idk.

Still, geez, 30$ for postage only?

If it follows the way they work the other stuff, it's a flat rate and you could buy more than one and still only pay 30 in postage. Largest order I ever got from them was two hoodies a mousemat and the Nami figure and I only paid 10 for the lot, despite it being shipped in two separate boxes.
